intro: Clidemia barkleyi, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Clidemia barkleyi plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
